results.title: The Week that shook the world
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, Burton Benjamin and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Traces the day by day events of the historic week in which Europe tottered on the brink of World War II. The week from the end of August and the beginning of September 1939 - the last peaceful days the world was to know for six years. It ended with Hitler’s blitzkrieg into Poland, eleven months after British Prime Minister Chamberlain’s “peace in our time” declaration followed the Munich Pact. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Week in pictures. Issue no. 300
results.brief_description: Magazine style newsreel with four short pieces. 1. Alex Carr the lion tamer from Bertrand Mills Circus puts the lions through their paces. 2. Shows how road research is helping to design better and safer roads. 3. London fashion review. Shows actress Moira Lister modelling clothes and someone who looks remarkably like Audrey Hepburn. 4. Comedy piece with Sam Costa and the Mayfair club with drinks at 1939 prices. Issue number 300.

results.title: The Week in pictures. Issue no. 296
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage. Includes: 1. Clock built into pavement. 2. In the park, bag snatcher repelled with dye. 3. Hair stylist “experimental hairdo”. 4. Wartime frogman and expert driver - exploring the depths of the Mediterranean. Underwater photography, concentrating on its potential to assist salvage operations, and marine science in general.

results.title: The Week in pictures. Issue no. 294
results.brief_description: Newsreel items include: The happenings and description of charm schools; renowned variety stars - The Voltaires; pupils at the Royal Navy Gunnery School get cracking under realistic training conditions; the World’s largest road vehicle, The Antar, on display before being shipped to the Middle east; Joe Davis, snooker champion shows of his skilled wares at the table.

results.title: The Wedding singer
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Robert Simonds, Brad Grey and Frank Coraci
results.brief_description: Set in 1985, this romantic comedy is pure 80’s nostalgia. Robbie Hart (Adam Sandler) is a singer at weddings and bar mitzvahs who sings hits of the eighties and knows how to keep the crowd happy. Julia (Drew Barrymore), is a waitress at the reception centre where Robbie often performs. When Robbie is stood up at the altar, he finds consolation in his new friendship with Julia, and he starts to fall for her. The only problem is that Julia is engaged to womaniser, Glenn, and asks Robbie to help her with her wedding plans. Robbie has to figure out how to make Julia realise that she is marrying the wrong man. Includes a great cameo by Steve Buscemi.

results.title: The Wedding party [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Oudine Productions, Brian De Palma, Wilfred Leach and Cynthia Munroe
results.brief_description: De Palma’s early black comedy tells the tale of Charlie and Jospehine, two college students who have decided to marry. But as the wedding day approaches the differences between the groom and the bride’s social worlds cause Charlie to rethink his tying of the knot. Set in the cloistered, snobbish world of New York “aristocracy”, “The Wedding Party” is a prankish send-up of family, wealth and matrimonial rites. Before developing the Hitchcock-influenced baroque horror films that were to make his reputation, De Palma was a comedy writer, activist and performer closely allied to the counter-culture and anti-Vietnam War movement. “The Wedding Party” makes clear its origins in the radical student subculture of the 1960s, but for a film based on a script which is dangerously chaotic and improvisary, De Palma’s masterful direction results in a film which is both coherent and elegant. Jill Clayburgh stars as the dizzy spoilt rich-brat Josephine and it features an early film performance by Robert de Niro as Charlie’s best friend, Cecil. With Jennifer Salt, Charles Pfluger.

results.title: The Wedding banquet
results.creator_credit: Central Motion Pictures Corporation, Good Machine, Ted Hope, James Schamus and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: Wai Tung, a successful real estate investor lives in New York with his lover Simon. Wai Tung’s parents, wondering why he is unmarried, enrol him with a matchmaking service. Simon believes the solution is for Wai Tung to marry Wei Wei, an illegal immigrant desperate to remain in America; a marriage of convenience solving both their problems! When the news reaches Taiwan, Wai Tung’s parents board the first plane to the Big Apple so they can preside over the traditional wedding banquet. Suddenly a little white lie turns into a fully fledged farce as the simple registry office ceremony escalates into an over-the-top reception where everyone wants to kiss the bride - except the groom! Starring Ah-Leh Gua, Sihung Lung, May Chin, Winston Chao and Mitchell Litchenstein. Winner Golden Bear Best Film: Berlin Film Festival, Best Director and Best Film: Seattle Film Festival, Critics Choice Best Film: Sydney Film Festival. Chinese dialogue with English subtitles.
